result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy A Pompa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct Ordinance Violation. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy A Pompa

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Troy A Pompa
Current: N1640 19th Ave, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States  (Effective: 08-07-2015)
Prior: N191640 19th Ave, Wautoma, WI 54982

Defendant Troy A Pompa in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on defendant's behalf.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant (d.o.b. 11-06-1985) appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct, Criminal Damage to Property.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  5/18/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
